intro: Polystorthia arboreum, commonly known as the tree spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, often clustered in umbels, and it produces a milky sap that is toxic. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
